    Background

    Background.Rmd
    library(CECPfuns)

    If you haven’t seen it already, you can find an introduction to the package in the Introduction vignette. You should be able to get to that with this.

    vignette("Introduction", package = "CECPfuns")

    Background

    The primary goal driving the creation of CECPfuns was selfish: to have a single repository of my functions that I could keep up to date and where I could easily find the latest version of any potentially reusable functions I have written. My first public posting about the package is here.

    Two of my colleagues, Dr. Clara Paz and Emily Blackshaw have encouraged me to think that this might become something of use for others and I am now very much working toward that aim and, with that in mind I have put the package on GitHub at https://github.com/cpsyctc/CECPfuns.

    Who are we?

    • You can find out more about Clara here.
    • You can find out more about Emily here and about her PhD, which I am supervising, at her ResearchGate project page.
    • My own sites are:
      • my biggest research programme, which overlaps with Emily’s work, the CORE system at https://www.coresystemtrust.org.uk/
      • a web site about my non-CORE work, which I am slowly (re)building from a much earlier one
      • my “R blog” or “SAFAQ” as I have called it of pages created using R and the distill package
      • pages which relate to a book, co-authored with Jo-anne Carlyle, coming out in autumn 2021: watch this space!
      • my personal site.
